Structs/ContextRef.html.name: ContextRef
Structs/ContextRef.html.abstract: The ContextRef type acts as a lightweight Swift reference to an underlying cairo_t instance.

Protocols/ScaledFontProtocol.html#/s:5Ca.name: ref()
Protocols/ScaledFontProtocol.html#/s:5Ca.abstract: Increases the reference count on @scaled_font by one. This prevents

Protocols/ScaledFontProtocol.html#/s:5Ca.name: unref()
Protocols/ScaledFontProtocol.html#/s:5Ca.abstract: Decreases the reference count on @font by one. If the result

Protocols/ScaledFontProtocol.html#/s:5Ca.name: type
Protocols/ScaledFontProtocol.html#/s:5Ca.abstract: type of the backend used to create

Protocols/ScaledFontProtocol.html#/s:5Ca.name: status
Protocols/ScaledFontProtocol.html#/s:5Ca.abstract: Allows to check whether an error has previously occurred for this

Protocols/ScaledFontProtocol.html#/s:5Ca.name: textExtents(_:)
Protocols/ScaledFontProtocol.html#/s:5Ca.abstract: Gets the extents for a string of text. The extents describe a

Protocols/ScaledFontProtocol.html#/s:5Ca.name: glyphExtents(_:)
Protocols/ScaledFontProtocol.html#/s:5Ca.abstract: Gets the extents for an array of glyphs. The extents describe a

Protocols/ScaledFontProtocol.html#/s:5Ca.name: textToGlyphs(_:x:y:)
Protocols/ScaledFontProtocol.html#/s:5Ca.abstract: Converts UTF-8 text to an array of glyphs, optionally with cluster

Protocols/ScaledFontProtocol.html#/s:5Ca.name: fontFace
Protocols/ScaledFontProtocol.html#/s:5Ca.abstract: the font face that this scaled font uses. This might be the

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: ptr
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Untyped pointer to the underlying cairo_t instance.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: _ptr
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Typed pointer to the underlying cairo_t instance.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: init(raw:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Required Initialiser for types conforming to ContextProtocol

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: context_ptr
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Typed pointer to the underlying context

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: ref()
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Increases the reference count on cr by one.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: unref()
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Decreases the reference count on cr by one.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: referenceCount
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Cairo context reference count

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: status
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Error status of the context

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: save()
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Makes a copy of the current state of cr

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: restore()
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Restores cr to the state saved by a preceding call to save() and removes that state from the stack of saved states.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: target
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Gets the target surface for the cairo context as passed to cairo_create().

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: pushGroup()
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Temporarily redirects drawing to an intermediate surface known as a group. The redirection lasts until the group is completed by a call to cairo_pop_group() or cairo_pop_group_to_source(). These calls provide the result of any drawing to the group as a pattern, (either as an explicit object, or set as the source pattern).

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: pushGroup(content:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Temporarily redirects drawing to an intermediate surface known as a group. The redirection lasts until the group is completed by a call to cairo_pop_group() or cairo_pop_group_to_source(). These calls provide the result of any drawing to the group as a pattern, (either as an explicit object, or set as the source pattern).

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: popGroup()
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Terminates the redirection begun by a call to cairo_push_group() or cairo_push_group_with_content() and returns a new pattern containing the results of all drawing operations performed to the group.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: popGroupToSource()
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Terminates the redirection begun by a call to cairo_push_group() or cairo_push_group_with_content() and installs the resulting pattern as the source pattern in the given cairo context.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: groupTarget
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Returns the current destination surface for the context. This is either the original target surface as passed to cairo_create() or the target surface for the current group as started by the most recent call to cairo_push_group() or cairo_push_group_with_content().

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: setSource(red:green:blue:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Sets the source pattern within cr to an opaque color. This opaque color will then be used for any subsequent drawing operation until a new source pattern is set.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: setSource(red:green:blue:alpha:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Sets the source pattern within cr to a translucent color. This color will then be used for any subsequent drawing operation until a new source pattern is set.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: source
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Source pattern within cr. This pattern will then be used for any subsequent drawing operation until a new source pattern is set.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: antiAlias
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Antialiasing mode of the rasterizer used for drawing shapes. This value is a hint, and a particular backend may or may not support a particular value. At the current time, no backend supports CAIRO_ANTIALIAS_SUBPIXEL when drawing shapes.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: setDash(_:offset:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Sets the dash pattern to be used by cairo_stroke(). A dash pattern is specified by dashes , an array of positive values. Each value provides the length of alternate “on” and “off” portions of the stroke. The offset specifies an offset into the pattern at which the stroke begins.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: dashCount
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: length of the dash array in cr (0 if dashing is not currently in effect).

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: dash
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Sets the dash pattern to be used by cairo_stroke(). A dash pattern is specified by dashes , an array of positive values. Each value provides the length of alternate “on” and “off” portions of the stroke. The offset specifies an offset into the pattern at which the stroke begins.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: fillRule
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Current fill rule within the cairo context. The fill rule is used to determine which regions are inside or outside a complex (potentially self-intersecting) path. The current fill rule affects both cairo_fill() and cairo_clip(). See cairo_fill_rule_t for details on the semantics of each available fill rule.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: lineCap
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Current line cap style within the cairo context. See cairo_line_cap_t for details about how the available line cap styles are drawn.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: lineJoin
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Current line join style within the cairo context. See cairo_line_join_t for details about how the available line join styles are drawn.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: lineWidth
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Current line width within the cairo context. The line width value specifies the diameter of a pen that is circular in user space, (though device-space pen may be an ellipse in general due to scaling/shear/rotation of the CTM).

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: miterLimit
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Current miter limit within the cairo context.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: mitreLimit
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Current mitre limit within the cairo context.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: operator
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Compositing operator to be used for all drawing operations. See cairo_operator_t for details on the semantics of each available compositing operator.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: compositingOperator
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Compositing operator to be used for all drawing operations. See cairo_operator_t for details on the semantics of each available compositing operator.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: tolerance
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Tolerance used when converting paths into trapezoids. Curved segments of the path will be subdivided until the maximum deviation between the original path and the polygonal approximation is less than tolerance. The default value is 0.1. A larger value will give better performance, a smaller value, better appearance. (Reducing the value from the default value of 0.1 is unlikely to improve appearance significantly.) The accuracy of paths within Cairo is limited by the precision of its internal arithmetic, and the prescribed tolerance is restricted to the smallest representable internal value.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: clip()
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Establishes a new clip region by intersecting the current clip region with the current path as it would be filled by cairo_fill() and according to the current fill rule (see cairo_set_fill_rule()).

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: clipPreserve()
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Establishes a new clip region by intersecting the current clip region with the current path as it would be filled by fill() and according to the current fill rule (see fillRule).

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: clipExtents
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Bounding box in user coordinates covering the area inside the current clip.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: isInClip(_:_:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Tests whether the given point is inside the area that would be visible through the current clip, i.e. the area that would be filled by a paint() operation.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: resetClip()
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Reset the current clip region to its original, unrestricted state. That is, set the clip region to an infinitely large shape containing the target surface. Equivalently, if infinity is too hard to grasp, one can imagine the clip region being reset to the exact bounds of the target surface.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: clipRectangleList
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Current clip region as a list of rectangles in user coordinates.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: fill()
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: A drawing operator that fills the current path according to the current fill rule, (each sub-path is implicitly closed before being filled). After fill(), the current path will be cleared from the cairo context. See fillRule() and fillPreserve().

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: fillPreserve()
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: A drawing operator that fills the current path according to the current fill rule, (each sub-path is implicitly closed before being filled). Unlike fill(), fillPreserve() preserves the path within the cairo context.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: fillExtents
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Bounding box in user coordinates covering the area that would be affected, (the “inked” area), by a cairo_fill() operation given the current path and fill parameters. If the current path is empty, returns an empty rectangle ((0,0), (0,0)). Surface dimensions and clipping are not taken into account.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: isInFill(_:_:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Tests whether the given point is inside the area that would be affected by a fill() operation given the current path and filling parameters. Surface dimensions and clipping are not taken into account.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: mask(pattern:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Drawing operator that paints the current source using the alpha channel of pattern as a mask. (Opaque areas of pattern are painted with the source, transparent areas are not painted.)

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: mask(surface:x:y:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: drawing operator that paints the current source using the alpha channel of surface as a mask. (Opaque areas of surface are painted with the source, transparent areas are not painted.)

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: paint()
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Drawing operator that paints the current source everywhere within the current clip region.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: paint(alpha:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Drawing operator that paints the current source everywhere within the current clip region using a mask of constant alpha value alpha . The effect is similar to paint(), but the drawing is faded out using the alpha value.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: stroke()
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Drawing operator that strokes the current path according to the current line width, line join, line cap, and dash settings. After stroke(), the current path will be cleared from the cairo context. See lineWidth, lineJoin, lineCap, dash, setDash(), and strokePreserve().

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: strokePreserve()
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Drawing operator that strokes the current path according to the current line width, line join, line cap, and dash settings. Unlike cairo_stroke(), cairo_stroke_preserve() preserves the path within the cairo context.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: strokeExtents
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Computes a bounding box in user coordinates covering the area that would be affected, (the “inked” area), by a cairo_stroke() operation given the current path and stroke parameters. If the current path is empty, returns an empty rectangle ((0,0), (0,0)). Surface dimensions and clipping are not taken into account.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: isInStroke(_:_:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Tests whether the given point is inside the area that would be affected by a cairo_stroke() operation given the current path and stroking parameters. Surface dimensions and clipping are not taken into account.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: copyPage()
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Emits the current page for backends that support multiple pages, but doesn’t clear it, so, the contents of the current page will be retained for the next page too. Use showPage() if you want to get an empty page after the emission.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: showPage()
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Emits and clears the current page for backends that support multiple pages. Use cairo_copy_page() if you don’t want to clear the page.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: userData(key:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Return user data previously attached to cr using the specified key. If no user data has been attached with the given key this function returns NULL.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: setUserData(key:value:destroy:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Attach user data to cr . To remove user data from a surface, call this function with the key that was used to set it and NULL for data .

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: newPath()
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Clears the current path. After this call there will be no path and no current point.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: path
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Creates a copy of the current path and returns it to the user as a cairo_path_t. See cairo_path_data_t for hints on how to iterate over the returned data structure.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: flatPath
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: flattened copy of the current path and returns it to the user as a cairo_path_t. See cairo_path_data_t for hints on how to iterate over the returned data structure.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: append(path:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Append the path onto the current path. The path may be either the return value from one of cairo_copy_path() or cairo_copy_path_flat() or it may be constructed manually. See cairo_path_t for details on how the path data structure should be initialized, and note that path->status must be initialized to CAIRO_STATUS_SUCCESS.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: hasCurrentPoint
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Returns whether a current point is defined on the current path. See currentPoint for details on the current point.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: currentPoint
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Gets the current point of the current path, which is conceptually the final point reached by the path so far.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: newSubPath()
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Begin a new sub-path. Note that the existing path is not affected. After this call there will be no current point.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: closePath()
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Adds a line segment to the path from the current point to the beginning of the current sub-path, (the most recent point passed to moveTo()), and closes this sub-path. After this call the current point will be at the joined endpoint of the sub-path.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: arc(xc:yc:radius:angle1:angle2:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Adds a circular arc of the given radius to the current path. The arc is centered at (xc , yc ), begins at angle1 and proceeds in the direction of increasing angles to end at angle2 . If angle2 is less than angle1 it will be progressively increased by .pi*2 until it is greater than angle1 .

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: arcNegative(xc:yc:radius:angle1:angle2:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Adds a circular arc of the given radius to the current path. The arc is centered at (xc , yc ), begins at angle1 and proceeds in the direction of decreasing angles to end at angle2 . If angle2 is greater than angle1 it will be progressively decreased by .pi*2 until it is less than angle1 .

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: curveTo(x1:y1:x2:y2:x3:y3:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Adds a cubic Bézier spline to the path from the current point to position (x3 , y3 ) in user-space coordinates, using (x1 , y1 ) and (x2 , y2 ) as the control points. After this call the current point will be (x3 , y3 ).

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: lineTo(_:_:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Adds a line to the path from the current point to position (x , y ) in user-space coordinates. After this call the current point will be (x , y ).

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: moveTo(_:_:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Begin a new sub-path. After this call the current point will be (x , y ).

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: rectangle(x:y:width:height:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Adds a closed sub-path rectangle of the given size to the current path at position (x , y ) in user-space coordinates.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: glyphPath(glyphs:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Adds closed paths for the glyphs to the current path. The generated path if filled, achieves an effect similar to that of showGlyphs().

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: textPath(_:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Adds closed paths for text to the current path. The generated

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: relCurveTo(dx1:dy1:dx2:dy2:dx3:dy3:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Relative-coordinate version of cairo_curve_to(). All offsets are relative to the current point. Adds a cubic Bézier spline to the path from the current point to a point offset from the current point by (dx3 , dy3 ), using points offset by (dx1 , dy1 ) and (dx2 , dy2 ) as the control points. After this call the current point will be offset by (dx3 , dy3 ).

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: relLineTo(_:_:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Relative-coordinate version of lineTo(). Adds a line to the path from the current point to a point that is offset from the current point by (dx , dy ) in user space. After this call the current point will be offset by (dx , dy ).

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: relMoveTo(_:_:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Begin a new sub-path. After this call the current point will offset by (x , y ).

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: pathExtents
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Computes a bounding box in user-space coordinates covering the points on the current path. If the current path is empty, returns an empty rectangle ((0,0), (0,0)). Stroke parameters, fill rule, surface dimensions and clipping are not taken into account.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: selectFontFace(_:slant:weight:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Note: The selectFontFace() function call is part of what

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: fontSize
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Sets the current font matrix to a scale by a factor of @size, replacing

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: fontMatrix
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: The font matrix gives a

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: setFont(options:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Sets a set of custom font rendering options for the #cairo_t.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: getFont(options:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Retrieves font rendering options set via #cairo_set_font_options.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: fontFace
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Current font face for a #cairo_t.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: scaledFont
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: the current scaled font for a #cairo_t.

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: showText(_:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: A drawing operator that generates the shape from a string of UTF-8

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: showText(_:length:glyphs:clusters:flags:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: This operation has rendering effects similar to showGlyphs()

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: textExtents(_:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Gets the extents for a string of text. The extents describe a

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: glyphExtents(_:)
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Gets the extents for an array of glyphs. The extents describe a

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.name: fontExtents
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html#/s:5Cairo.abstract: Font extents for the currently selected font

Protocols/ContextProtocol.html.name: ContextProtocol
Protocols/ContextProtocol.html.abstract: The ContextProtocol protocol exposes the methods and properties of an underlying cairo_t instance.

Protocols/DeviceProtocol.html.name: DeviceProtocol
Protocols/DeviceProtocol.html.abstract: The DeviceProtocol protocol exposes the methods and properties of an underlying cairo_device_t instance.

Protocols/SurfaceProtocol.html.name: SurfaceProtocol
Protocols/SurfaceProtocol.html.abstract: The SurfaceProtocol protocol exposes the methods and properties of an underlying cairo_surface_t instance.

Protocols/MatrixProtocol.html.name: MatrixProtocol
Protocols/MatrixProtocol.html.abstract: The MatrixProtocol protocol exposes the methods and properties of an underlying cairo_matrix_t instance.

Protocols/PatternProtocol.html.name: PatternProtocol
Protocols/PatternProtocol.html.abstract: The PatternProtocol protocol exposes the methods and properties of an underlying cairo_pattern_t instance.

Protocols/RegionProtocol.html.name: RegionProtocol
Protocols/RegionProtocol.html.abstract: The RegionProtocol protocol exposes the methods and properties of an underlying cairo_region_t instance.

Protocols/FontOptionsProtocol.html.name: FontOptionsProtocol
Protocols/FontOptionsProtocol.html.abstract: The FontOptionsProtocol protocol exposes the methods and properties of an underlying cairo_font_options_t instance.

Protocols/FontFaceProtocol.html.name: FontFaceProtocol
Protocols/FontFaceProtocol.html.abstract: The FontFaceProtocol protocol exposes the methods and properties of an underlying cairo_font_face_t instance.

Protocols/ScaledFontProtocol.html.name: ScaledFontProtocol
Protocols/ScaledFontProtocol.html.abstract: The ScaledFontProtocol protocol exposes the methods and properties of an underlying cairo_scaled_font_t instance.

Protocols/PathProtocol.html.name: PathProtocol
Protocols/PathProtocol.html.abstract: The PathProtocol protocol exposes the methods and properties of an underlying cairo_path_t instance.

Protocols/RectangleProtocol.html.name: RectangleProtocol
Protocols/RectangleProtocol.html.abstract: The RectangleProtocol protocol exposes the methods and properties of an underlying cairo_rectangle_t instance.

Protocols/RectangleIntProtocol.html.name: RectangleIntProtocol
Protocols/RectangleIntProtocol.html.abstract: The RectangleIntProtocol protocol exposes the methods and properties of an underlying cairo_rectangle_int_t instance.

Classes/RectangleInt.html#/s:5Cairo12Rec.name: ptr
Classes/RectangleInt.html#/s:5Cairo12Rec.abstract: Untyped pointer to the underlying `cairo_rectangle_int_t` instance.

Classes/RectangleInt.html#/s:5Cairo12Rec.name: init(_:)
Classes/RectangleInt.html#/s:5Cairo12Rec.abstract: Designated initialiser from the underlying C data type.

Classes/RectangleInt.html#/s:5Cairo12Rec.name: init(_:)
Classes/RectangleInt.html#/s:5Cairo12Rec.abstract: Designated initialiser from a constant pointer to the underlying C data type.

Classes/RectangleInt.html#/s:5Cairo12Rec.name: init(_:)
Classes/RectangleInt.html#/s:5Cairo12Rec.abstract: Optional initialiser from a constant pointer to the underlying C data type.

Classes/RectangleInt.html#/s:5Cairo12Rec.name: init(_:)
Classes/RectangleInt.html#/s:5Cairo12Rec.abstract: Optional initialiser from the underlying C data type.

Classes/RectangleInt.html#/s:5Cairo12Rec.name: init(retaining:)
Classes/RectangleInt.html#/s:5Cairo12Rec.abstract: Designated initialiser from the underlying C data type.

Classes/RectangleInt.html#/s:5Cairo12Rec.name: init(_:)
Classes/RectangleInt.html#/s:5Cairo12Rec.abstract: Reference intialiser for a related type that implements RectangleIntProtocol
